msContents.summary: Receipts for deliveries of gold and silver bullion by Aurelius Isidoros and members of his family; the payments are related to the "synone," a governmental buying-up of uncoined gold and silver from landowners

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 27 lines; the back is blank
May have been part of the same roll as P.Col. VII 139

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell in in 1924; no. 17 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Aurelii Achillas and Kasianos, tesserarii of the village of Karanis, to Aurelia Ameis daughter of Horion, greeting. We have received from you in accordance with the divine command, for the assessment imposed, one ounce, three grams of pure uncoined silver, that is, 1 oz., 3 gr., and of gold likewise two and one-fourth grams, that is 2 1/4 gr. I, Aurelius Achillas, have signed. Year 16 and 4, 12 days before the Calends of June. And likewise Isidoros son of Ptolemaios, a half and an eighth gram of pure gold, that is, 1/2, 1/8 gr. I, Aurelius Achillas, have signed. And likewise the same man, a fourth and a sixteenth gram of pure gold, that is, 1/4, 1/16 gr.
